pages.text: Storing soul is one of soulbending's core problems: soul is a frail and ethereal substance, and storing it outside of one's body is a task of no ease. With the discovery of sculk it was found that sculk, being a necrophage moss, is very capable at absorbing soul.

However, soul is almost instantly consumed for nutrition of sculk so it is a must to use soulfilled ingots and echo shards to stabilize it and use as a soul battery. Such a battery is called Soul catcher

Soul Catcher can be refilled using ghosts binders. When a ghost is banished using a ghosts binder its essence is consumed by a Soul Catcher, refilling it by a small amount proportionate to the power of banished ghost
